Description.134:
TechTO is seeking a full-time Content Marketing Coordinator to help carry out company-wide marketing activities. This person will focus on producing and promoting high-quality content about TechTOs events and the Canadian tech industry via our newsletters, podcasts, social media, and web channels to enhance the experience of our growing community. 
 
What you will do: 
 
Research, write, and produce our weekly content. You will be supporting our Growth Marketing Manager by researching, writing and collaborating on content for our community! Our newsletter goes out 4x per week and is full of juicy tech industry intel. We also host a Quick Takes podcast each Thursday, which you will help produce. You will ensure that our newsletters, social media posts, and podcasts deliver the best content possible - so strong written communication is a must! 
 
Help manage our communities. We maintain a lot of communication with and content for our general community, partners, and Insider members. You will help ensure that we have a steady pipeline of content from these sources, and reach out to community members about opportunities to be featured. 
 
Promote our events via Social Media. You will help make sure that we are communicating with our community about all opportunities to attend both virtual and IRL events. Youll work with our Growth Marketing Manager to ensure that each TechTO event is supported by a well-rounded marketing plan. You will also help develop most of our social media content. 
 
Clean-up and maintain our website and video content. Our website could use some re-structuring to ensure that our events and content are easy to find. It would be great if you have some experience designing and updating web pages so that our website is always up-to-date and accurate. 
 
Jump-in and help with ad-hoc tasks. Were a small team with a lot going on. There will be plenty of opportunities to learn about every facet of our business and community. Were looking for a self-starter who asks lots of questions and can adapt to changing circumstances in a fast-paced environment. 
 
What success looks like: 
 
You own day-to-day marketing tasks and activities, allowing the Growth Marketing Manager to focus on long-term strategy and initiatives. You become a TechTO community champion and communicate opportunities and feedback to the core team. You take pride in your work. We do some really cool stuff, and youll be an integral part of making sure our community loves it. Youve got this. You can execute your tasks confidently and enjoy creative problem solving. Were still mostly working from home, so its important for us all to trust that tasks are being completed independently. Were all happy to jump in and support navigating challenges, dont expect constant hand-holding or micromanaging. You love to learn and build connections. Our community is all about enriching Canadas tech ecosystem with shared lessons and experiences. Change thrills you. We adapt to changing circumstances from a wide variety of key stakeholders all of the time. 
 
You are: 
A recent marketing graduate or have 1-2 years of experience coordinating marketing initiatives in a fast-paced environment. Preference will be given to folks who are available long-term. 
 
Eager to make things happen, from idea to delivery and every step in between 
A concise communicator whos strong at summarizing key information and interested in developing your copywriting skills. 
 
Familiar with platforms like: Hubspot, LinkedIn, Instagram, Twitter, Youtube, Canva, Webflow, Google Workspace, Slack 
 
Interested in tech: the community, companies, and entrepreneurs that are changing the world. 
Comfortable with independent work but dont hesitate to raise your hand and ask questions when you need guidance or support. 
 
Excited by self-guided learning. 
 
Able to organize and prioritize multiple tasks at once. 
 
Excited by the opportunity to build a role in a growing company. This is a new position and were excited about creating a set of responsibilities that matches the skills and passions of the candidate. 
 
You enjoy a feeling of success. As part of the TechTO team, we want everyone to learn new skills, experience personal growth, and develop new responsibilities. 
 
Whats in it for you: 
 
We may be biased but were a pretty rad team. We may not have beer on Fridays or a foosball table, but we value everyones voice, we care about our teams personal and professional growth, and we want you to find your space to thrive at TechTO. We move fast and we adapt quickly. If youre someone who is excited about taking ownership and driving digital content, then we want you to come along for the ride. 
 
How to apply: 
 
Email: apply directly on this post with: 
Your resumeLink to your LinkedinA short note about why you think you'd be good for the job (we dont need a full cover letter) 
 
About TechTO 
 
TechTO aspires to build a community that makes Canada the best place in the world to start or scale a technology company. To make that vision a reality, we focus on three broad goals: improving access to the innovation economy, sharing strategies to accelerate professional success, and promoting the tech communitys contributions to society. Plus, we like to make people laugh. 
 
We support entrepreneurs and innovators at all stages of their careers and businesses. We host events, both in-person and online. We help people develop new skills. We connect people and expand networks. We build relationships and form partnerships. We speak with the media. We advocate for the tech sector. We meet with governments and policymakers. In short, we do whatever it takes to support Canadas tech community. Check out techto.org to learn more about what we do. 
 
TechTO is an equal opportunity employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. TechTO is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for everyone and providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment.

Description.140:
We're looking for an organized and driven Accounting intern to join our finance team at BrightOrder Inc. The Accounting intern position will work closely with General Accountant, Finance Manager and Operations personnel.The intern will be part of a dynamic Finance team with experience in Accounts Receivable - Billing/Collections, Accounts Payable, and Payroll. This range of experience will give you the confidence to take on additional roles as required and support the team's objectives. 
The successful candidate will be talented and self-motivated, a quick learner and versatile that is comfortable working in a fast-paced and evolving environment. This position requires someone who can work within a team, both within the finance group and with employees at all levels of the organization. 
 
Please note, this internship is part time 24 hours per week. 
 
Main Responsibilities: 
 
Support General Accountant for full accounting cycle and preparation of financial statements;Prepare general ledger entries by maintaining records and files, reconciling accounts, preparing and maintaining monthly prepaid schedulesMaintain customers billing on a daily basis;Update the customers subscription billing software platform along with the customers credit card payment platform. Deal with new customers quires when needed;Investigate billing and payment discrepancy. Resolving issues associated with unmatched receipts and resolving customer queries;Maintain a high level of professional service and customer satisfaction in all interactions with external and internal customers to promote prompt payment of receivables;Monitor A/R aging and collection of past due balances, if any. Ad-hoc AR Aging reports as requested by management;Suppliers bills review against purchase agreements and purchase orders. Bills entry and payment preparation;Suppliers account reconciliation and communication with local and international vendorsUpload and track expense reports from the expense management software into the accounting system;Process bank deposits and monthly payments. Reconcile general and subsidiary bank accounts by gathering and balancing information. Complete monthly credit card reconciliations;Complete monthly payroll reconciliation and records for all subsidiaries;Provide assistance in month-end and year-end closing - account reconciliations, accruals, journal entries and analysis; Provides financial status information by preparing special reports; completing special projects;Any additional duties and responsibilities as may be assigned from time to time.Ensure and enforce compliance to all company and legislated Safety policies and procedures;Updates job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications. 
 
Key Competencies & Requirements: 
 
Highly organized, exceptional attention to detail, accuracy and able to multi-task and prioritize in a fast-paced environment;Excellent problem-solving skills as well as strong written and verbal communication skills;Excellent analytical, financial, and mathematical abilitiesAbility to gather data, establish facts, draw valid conclusions, and propose solutions;Proficient with financial systems, processes and technology;Knowledge of General Accounting Principles and ProceduresIntermediate level MS Excel skills including VLOOKUP's and pivot tables is required Have an intellectual curiosity for discovery and questioning the status quoKnow what they do not know, and ask before actionStress tolerance due to fluctuations in workload. 
 
Education and Experience: 
Enrollment in a Bachelor's Degree/ Program in Accounting and/or FinanceKnowledge of advanced accountingAdvanced computer skills in MS Office, accounting software, and databasesExperience with SaaS companies - an asset 
 
If you are interested in this position, then please submit your resume AND send a short 2 minute introductory video telling us why you would be an excellent fit for the position to the email: recruiting@brightorder.com.

Project Management Coordinator Responsibilities:

Description.146:
We're looking for an organized and driven Accounting intern to join our finance team at BrightOrder Inc. The Accounting intern position will work closely with General Accountant, Finance Manager and Operations personnel.The intern will be part of a dynamic Finance team with experience in Accounts Receivable - Billing/Collections, Accounts Payable, and Payroll. This range of experience will give you the confidence to take on additional roles as required and support the team's objectives. 
The successful candidate will be talented and self-motivated, a quick learner and versatile that is comfortable working in a fast-paced and evolving environment. This position requires someone who can work within a team, both within the finance group and with employees at all levels of the organization. 
 
Please note, this internship is part time 24 hours per week. 
 
Main Responsibilities: 
 
Support General Accountant for full accounting cycle and preparation of financial statements;Prepare general ledger entries by maintaining records and files, reconciling accounts, preparing and maintaining monthly prepaid schedulesMaintain customers billing on a daily basis;Update the customers subscription billing software platform along with the customers credit card payment platform. Deal with new customers quires when needed;Investigate billing and payment discrepancy. Resolving issues associated with unmatched receipts and resolving customer queries;Maintain a high level of professional service and customer satisfaction in all interactions with external and internal customers to promote prompt payment of receivables;Monitor A/R aging and collection of past due balances, if any. Ad-hoc AR Aging reports as requested by management;Suppliers bills review against purchase agreements and purchase orders. Bills entry and payment preparation;Suppliers account reconciliation and communication with local and international vendorsUpload and track expense reports from the expense management software into the accounting system;Process bank deposits and monthly payments. Reconcile general and subsidiary bank accounts by gathering and balancing information. Complete monthly credit card reconciliations;Complete monthly payroll reconciliation and records for all subsidiaries;Provide assistance in month-end and year-end closing - account reconciliations, accruals, journal entries and analysis; Provides financial status information by preparing special reports; completing special projects;Any additional duties and responsibilities as may be assigned from time to time.Ensure and enforce compliance to all company and legislated Safety policies and procedures;Updates job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications. 
 
Key Competencies & Requirements: 
 
Highly organized, exceptional attention to detail, accuracy and able to multi-task and prioritize in a fast-paced environment;Excellent problem-solving skills as well as strong written and verbal communication skills;Excellent analytical, financial, and mathematical abilitiesAbility to gather data, establish facts, draw valid conclusions, and propose solutions;Proficient with financial systems, processes and technology;Knowledge of General Accounting Principles and ProceduresIntermediate level MS Excel skills including VLOOKUP's and pivot tables is required Have an intellectual curiosity for discovery and questioning the status quoKnow what they do not know, and ask before actionStress tolerance due to fluctuations in workload. 
 
Education and Experience: 
Enrollment in a Bachelor's Degree/ Program in Accounting and/or FinanceKnowledge of advanced accountingAdvanced computer skills in MS Office, accounting software, and databasesExperience with SaaS companies - an asset 
 
If you are interested in this position, then please submit your resume AND send a short 2 minute introductory video telling us why you would be an excellent fit for the position to the email: recruiting@brightorder.com.

Description.148:
We believe that everyone has the right to DEFINE themselves and their future. 
 
That includes YOU. 
 
How would you like to do it in a fun, high-performance culture thats truly one of a kind  on a team that appreciates you for being you, helps our members retire with confidence and makes Canada better, all at the same time? 
 
If that sounds like your thing  and youre an exceptional Administrative Assistant  wed like to hear from you. 
 
Were CAAT Pension Plan, and were growing. We innovate defined benefit (DB) pension plans. What are they? Unlike other pension plans, they specifically define the lifetime benefits our members will receive in retirement. This means that our members know exactly what theyre getting every month  for life! Because we provide that certainty, we help more Canadians retire with greater financial security and priceless peace of mind and take pressure off the social safety net at the very same time, which frees up those resources for other Canadians who really need them. 
 
We are looking for a conscientious critical thinker to join our Pension Solutions team as an Administrative Assistant where the work will be dynamic and sometimes unpredictable. This role is important because you will be the day-to-day conduit between teams, providing administrative and support services to the Pension Solutions Team. 
 
 
We are look for someone with the following attribute: 
 
Excellent communication skills (both written and oral)Exceptional judgement, strong team player, thorough, and logicalExceptional interpersonal skills, with a positive can-do approachExperience with project coordination Someone who thrives juggling multiple priorities 
 
A University or College Degree in Business, Office Administration or equivalent, with two years or more of progressive office support experience make you an ideal candidate. You must also have an aptitude for project coordination, a high proficiency in Microsoft Office (including proficiency in Excel), and Customer Relations Management (CRM) software experience. 
 
Once here: 
 
You will provide a full range of administrative and support servicesYou will coordinate a variety of project initiatives and tasksYou will assist in preparation for and facilitation of internal and external meetingsYou will provide support in the preparation of internal reportsYou will assist with other tasks as assigned 
 
 
What does CAAT offer you and what should you know about us? 
 
Our vision is to provide an environment where employees can bring their whole, authentic selves to work. Thats what drives our high-performance, fun culture  one thats truly one of a kind. In fact, we have been recognized as one of Canada's Most Admired Corporate Cultures for 2019 and 2020, as one of Greater Toronto's Top Employers for 2020 and 2021, and by Canadian HR Reporter as one of the Best Places to Work for 2021.We provide (no big surprise here!) membership in CAATs defined benefit (DB) pension plan, a flexible and friendly work environment, a comprehensive health and dental benefits package, life insurance, and an array of wellness programsEveryone is a leader at CAAT, so we invest in our people and enthusiastically support your career development goals, regardless of your role, with access to tuition aid and learning opportunities like our ground-breaking CAAT AcademyWe are conveniently located at the Eaton Centre in downtown Toronto, next to Queen Subway station, with ready access to multiple TTC routes, GO Transit, and the PATH.We are working remotely at present due to the COVID-19 pandemic, and in the future will be offering a flexible, hybrid work arrangement.You can learn more at www.caatpension.ca 
 
DEFINITELY INTERESTED? Apply on LinkedIn and include your resume and cover letter or email your resume and cover letter to careers@caatpension.ca on or before May 20, 2022, with  Administrative Assistant in the subject line. 
 
We recruit and select the most qualified candidates and thank all applicants for their interest. Only those considered for an interview will be contacted. 
 
CAAT Pension Plan is an equal opportunity employer that supports abilities and diversity of all kinds. If you require accommodation during the recruiting and selection process, please contact us at hr@caatpension.ca or call Human Resources at 416-673-9000.

Description.156:
This is an exciting opportunity to have a key role in overseeing the Information Technology (IT) and Security function at one of Volaris largest portfolios. We have an ambitious vision for acquired and organic growth, globally; combined with ever increasing Data Security and Governance, Risk, and Compliance requirements. Working closely with the Portfolio CFO and the Business Unit leaders, you will have an excellent opportunity to continue to grow and develop an IT strategy, and play an important role as we acquire, strengthen, and grow an expanding Portfolio across the Americas. 
 
If you have a proven track record in a Senior IT and Data Security leadership role, strong work ethic, good interpersonal skills, and the ability to interact with business owners & leaders, we are looking for you. 
 
Responsibilities: 
Overall responsibility for the Portfolios IT, Data Security & Risk Management.Continue to develop and enhance a Portfolio IT & Data Security strategy that allows the portfolio to scale autonomously while ensuring it complies with Volaris & Modaxos corporate standards and governance framework.Review the current state of the Portfolios IT & Data Security compliance with Volaris Governance, Risk Compliance framework, and play an important role in oversight, compliance, control setting, and auditing.Create Portfolio IT & Data Security reporting and dashboards that are reviewed with the executive leadership team regularly.As part of the Mergers & Acquisitions team, identify and propose solutions to IT and Data Security issues found during due diligence and ensure plans are in place post-close to mitigate risks.For all new acquisitions, develop an IT & Data Security integration and compliance checklist, and play an important part of onboarding new acquisitions, including completing the integration of recently acquired businesses.Indirect oversight of all divisional IT teams, supporting the IT leaders and addressing issues and projects arising at their level.Track and manage the Portfolios IT spend, benchmarking, and working to consolidated and reduce operating costs and improve the efficient use of assets across the group.Understand IT infrastructure investments and asset acquisition needs and identify areas of optimization, risk mitigation, and cost-efficiency.Undertake special projects and analysis as required by Portfolio or Business Unit leadership teamsManage the Application Security Product and provide guidance to the Portfolio on the Secure Software Development Process (SSDLC)Lead a Portfolio data security committee, managing the security policies along with security awareness program for businesses in Modaxo Americas. 
 
Education and Experience: 
7 to 8 years of IT experience, including deep exposure to networks and systems at an architect level.One or more security certifications including CISSP is preferredKnowledge of HIPAAHosting environment (Azure, GCP & AWS) architecture and supplier management experience.Proven track record of building strong working relationships with business and IT partners while fostering a cooperative work environment.Ability to think critically, solve problems, and make Portfolio level decisions while building trust within the Volaris head office IT organization.Experience working with Governance, Risk, and Compliance frameworks, including analysis, recommending, implementing, and auditing.Strong project management skills coordinating multiple concurrent complex and high priority projects.Track record of solving large, complex problems and producing measurable results.Self-starter with excellent verbal and written communication skills.Experience building and supporting a global IT team.Experience with global IT and Data Security standards and requirements preferred.Must be willing to travel internationally as required. 
 
If you think this is an exciting role for you. Go ahead and apply at below link: 
 
https://volarisgroup.wd3.myworkdayjobs.com/en-US/Trapeze/details/Director--Information-Technology_R37520

Description.159:
We are hiring for a Meetings and Events Manager. 
Candidate Value Proposition: 
The successful candidate will have the opportunity to gain further knowledge in corporate events planning with a top 5 bank. 
 
Typical Day in Role: 
Provide Support to the Senior Manager and/or the Director while implementing logistic support for various events the team is engaged with, such as quarterly town halls, forums, and meetings on behalf of internal partners.This includes, but is not limited to: negotiating supplier/vendor contracts; collaborating on the event theme design, and coordinating event production schedules and logistical details as appropriate for each event.Work in collaboration with other Event Managers and internal clients to help with the design and management of selected RBC events.Build positive relationships with client groups by demonstrating competence and creativity in supporting their event requirements.Communicate with internal partners and internal & external suppliers in a skilled and professional manner.Support with the management ofall supplier activity during events, including, but not limited to, facility staff, florists, decor vendors, and entertainment.Analyze and produce event-related communications including reports, critical paths, pre-event plans, registration and proposals, and budgets and post-event summaries.Manage the collection of content for the meeting/event including; PPT, video, external speaker presentations, banners, logos, Mobile appContribute to the maintenance of the Meetings & Events Team RBCnet website and RBC Connect websites and research, write and grow the content, including templates and tutorials.Keep current on industry news and trends. 
 
 
Candidate Requirements/Must Have Skills: 
Degree/diploma or equivalent in event management or hospitalityMinimum 4 years of work experience in meeting/event planning.Ability to work very effectively and collaboratively in a team environmentStrong planning, organization, and problem-solving skills in order to manage multiple projects, with the ability to identify challenges and propose solutionsCommunication and verbal and written communications skills; strong customer service orientation; ability to interact effectively with senior-level management.Flexible attitude, teamwork and cooperation skills; collaboration, relationship building skills, sound judgment, diplomacy, and discretion.Ability and willingness to travel within the GTA area for various event locations/sites.Event Management/Registration tools experience: TemboSocial, Cvent, Survey Monkey, Limelight, QuickMobile App 
 
Nice-To-Have Skills: 
CMP Preferred or working towards CMP designation 
 
Additional Notes: 
 Flexibility to work evenings and weekends 
 Ability and flexibility to travel to off-site venues for site inspection and execution as necessary; 
 
To Apply: 
Please apply with your resume in Word format 
 
Thank you for applying with us. 
*Please note: due to a high volume of applicants, only those chosen who best match the skills and experience will be contacted.

Description.165:
We are looking for a responsible Administrative Assistant to perform a variety of administrative and clerical tasks. 
 
The duties of the Administrative Assistant include providing support to our managers and employees, assisting in daily office needs, and managing our companys general administrative activities. 
 
What does an Administrative Assistant do? 
Administrative Assistant responsibilities include making travel and meeting arrangements, preparing reports, and maintaining appropriate filing systems. The ideal candidate should have excellent oral and written communication skills and be able to organize their work using tools, like MS Excel and office equipment. If you also have previous experience as a Secretary or Executive Administrative Assistant and familiarity with our industry, wed like to meet you. 
 
Ultimately, a successful Admin Assistant should ensure the efficient and smooth day-to-day operation of our office. 
 
Responsibilities; 
Answer and direct phone calls 
Organize and schedule appointments 
Plan meetings and take detailed minutes 
Write and distribute email, correspondence memos, letters, faxes, and forms 
Assist in the preparation of regularly scheduled reports 
Develop and maintain a filing system 
Update and maintain office policies and procedures 
Order office supplies and research new deals and suppliers 
Maintain contact lists 
Book travel arrangements 
Submit and reconcile expense reports 
Provide general support to visitors 
Act as the point of contact for internal and external clients 
Liaise with executive and senior administrative assistants to handle requests and queries from senior managers 
 
Requirements; 
Proven experience as an Administrative Assistant, Virtual Assistant, or Office Admin Assistant 
Knowledge of office management systems and procedures 
Working knowledge of office equipment, like printers and fax machines 
Proficiency in MS Office (MS Excel and MS PowerPoint, in particular) 
Excellent time management skills and the ability to prioritize work 
Attention to detail and problem-solving skills 
Excellent written and verbal communication skills 
Strong organizational skills with the ability to multi-task 
High School degree; additional qualification as an Administrative assistant or Secretary will be a plus. 
 
Important Note: 
 
The Job briefing and interview session will be conducted online via the Skype app. 
Are you familiar with Skype? If not, You are required to download the app on the Google Play Store or App Store.

(talent@hrmprojectdept.com), send a message to her in regards to an online interview.

Paraza Pharma, Inc 
 
 
 
 
Job Description For M.Sc. Candidate 
 
Synthesis of target molecules as part of a medicinal chemistry teamTroubleshoot and optimize reaction sequencesParticipation in medicinal chemistry team meetingsPresentation of results to chemistry and project teams 
Minimum Qualifications 
 
 
Preferred Qualifications 
Comprehensive knowledge of modern synthetic organic chemistryDemonstrated laboratory proficiencyIn-depth knowledge and hands-on experience with a range of standard laboratory instrumentation, purification techniques (e.g. NMR, MS, automated chromatography), and data analysisProven research track record as evidenced by a strong publication and/or patent recordExcellent oral and written communication skills

Who We Are 
Our Brands

Position Summary 
 
 
Key Roles & Responsibilities 
Execution of QC Lab Testing 
Monitor Critical Control Parameters (lab process water, pH, balance) through daily equipment verification checks and alert QC lab manager of any out of trend eventsConduct simple routine and non-routine analysis of raw materials, mass and finished goods (labs to define specific examples) and report results. This includes responsibility for sample preparation, entering results into SAP/LIMS and preparation of CoAsConduct environmental monitoring testing and validationComplete documentation as needed to support testing proceduresWork with Lab Coordinator to retain or discard sample, archive lab documents 
Testing Data Review - Data Reviewer role responsibilities (% will vary by site) 
Review of routine/non-routine supporting test data and results, including sample preparation records, logbooks, calculations, and data sheets. Enter results in SAP/LIMS, as needed 
Investigation 
Identify quality problems & escalate to leadershipIndependent decision making ability required in straight forward situationsPerform Phase 1 OOS laboratory investigations with guidance from senior lab analystsConduct Quality Control evaluations of consumer complaints and Quality Inquiries 
Qualifications 
JOB REQUIREMENTS & QUALIFICATIONS 
Education 
 
 
Experience 
 
 
Additional Job Specifications 
Experience in a microbiology, analytical chemistry or product evaluation laboratory in Quality Control for a global consumer goods or pharma companyPhysical product or Microbiology evaluation skills preferred with emphasis on color matching & fine fragrance odor evaluation ability, as applicable to roleAwareness and practice of safe lab proceduresKnowledge of laboratory testing techniques (GMP, GDP and Good Lab Practices) and proficient use of all laboratory equipmentProficient oral and written communication skills and ability to appropriately communicate information to managementAbility to write SOPs, deviations, change controls and OOS reportsProblem solving skillsKnowledge of cosmetic ingredients & manufacturing procedures preferredProficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and SAP systems is preferredMust be flexible to work different shifts and overtime as neededMust be able to lift 35 lbs

Schedule 
 
 
Shift

Description.184:
Our company is seeking to hire a project coordinator who will be in charge of assisting our project managers in organizing our ongoing projects. This task involves monitoring project plans, schedules, work hours, budgets, and expenditures, organizing and participating in stakeholder meetings, and ensuring that project deadlines are met in a timely manner. 
To be successful as a project coordinator, you will need to be able to work on tight deadlines, be competent in using Microsoft Office applications such as Word and Excel, and have exceptional verbal, written, and presentation skills. 
Project Management Coordinator Responsibilities: 
Maintaining and monitoring project plans, project schedules, work hours, budgets, and expenditures.Organizing, attending, and participating in stakeholder meetings.Documenting and following up on important actions and decisions from meetings.Preparing necessary presentation materials for meetings.Ensuring project deadlines are met.Determining project changes.Providing administrative support as needed.Undertaking project tasks as required.Developing project strategies.Ensuring projects adhere to frameworks and all documentation is maintained appropriately for each project.Assess project risks and issues and provide solutions where applicable.Ensure stakeholder views are managed towards the best solution.Chair and facilitate meetings where appropriate and distribute minutes to all project team members.Create a project management calendar for fulfilling each goal and objective. 
Project Management Coordinator Requirements: 
Bachelor's degree Exceptional verbal, written, and presentation skills.Ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team.Experience using computers for a variety of tasks.Competency in Microsoft applications including Word, Excel, and Outlook.Knowledge of file management, transcription, and other administrative procedures.Two weeks of paid training required.Ability to work on tight deadlines.

Description.191:
We are hiring for a Meetings and Events Manager. 
Candidate Value Proposition: 
The successful candidate will have the opportunity to gain further knowledge in corporate events planning with a top 5 bank. 
 
Typical Day in Role: 
Provide Support to the Senior Manager and/or the Director while implementing logistic support for various events the team is engaged with, such as quarterly town halls, forums, and meetings on behalf of internal partners.This includes, but is not limited to: negotiating supplier/vendor contracts; collaborating on the event theme design, and coordinating event production schedules and logistical details as appropriate for each event.Work in collaboration with other Event Managers and internal clients to help with the design and management of selected RBC events.Build positive relationships with client groups by demonstrating competence and creativity in supporting their event requirements.Communicate with internal partners and internal & external suppliers in a skilled and professional manner.Support with the management ofall supplier activity during events, including, but not limited to, facility staff, florists, decor vendors, and entertainment.Analyze and produce event-related communications including reports, critical paths, pre-event plans, registration and proposals, and budgets and post-event summaries.Manage the collection of content for the meeting/event including; PPT, video, external speaker presentations, banners, logos, Mobile appContribute to the maintenance of the Meetings & Events Team RBCnet website and RBC Connect websites and research, write and grow the content, including templates and tutorials.Keep current on industry news and trends. 
 
 
Candidate Requirements/Must Have Skills: 
Degree/diploma or equivalent in event management or hospitalityMinimum 4 years of work experience in meeting/event planning.Ability to work very effectively and collaboratively in a team environmentStrong planning, organization, and problem-solving skills in order to manage multiple projects, with the ability to identify challenges and propose solutionsCommunication and verbal and written communications skills; strong customer service orientation; ability to interact effectively with senior-level management.Flexible attitude, teamwork and cooperation skills; collaboration, relationship building skills, sound judgment, diplomacy, and discretion.Ability and willingness to travel within the GTA area for various event locations/sites.Event Management/Registration tools experience: TemboSocial, Cvent, Survey Monkey, Limelight, QuickMobile App 
 
Nice-To-Have Skills: 
CMP Preferred or working towards CMP designation 
 
Additional Notes: 
 Flexibility to work evenings and weekends 
 Ability and flexibility to travel to off-site venues for site inspection and execution as necessary; 
 
To Apply: 
Please apply with your resume in Word format 
 
Thank you for applying with us. 
*Please note: due to a high volume of applicants, only those chosen who best match the skills and experience will be contacted.

Degree/diploma or equivalent in event management or hospitalityMinimum 4 years of work experience in meeting/event planning.Ability to work very effectively and collaboratively in a team environmentStrong planning, organization, and problem-solving skills in order to manage multiple projects, with the ability to identify challenges and propose solutionsCommunication and verbal and written communications skills; strong customer service orientation; ability to interact effectively with senior-level management.Flexible attitude, teamwork and cooperation skills; collaboration, relationship building skills, sound judgment, diplomacy, and discretion.Ability and willingness to travel within the GTA area for various event locations/sites.Event Management/Registration tools experience: TemboSocial, Cvent, Survey Monkey, Limelight, QuickMobile App 
 
Nice-To-Have Skills: 
CMP Preferred or working towards CMP designation 
 
Additional Notes: 
 Flexibility to work evenings and weekends 
 Ability and flexibility to travel to off-site venues for site inspection and execution as necessary; 
 
To Apply: 
Please apply with your resume in Word format 
 
Thank you for applying with us. 
*Please note: due to a high volume of applicants, only those chosen who best match the skills and experience will be contacted.

Description.200:
Organization: 
The Information and Privacy Commissioner of Ontario 
 
Division / Department: 
Tribunal and Dispute Resolution Division / Intake & Early Resolution Department 
 
City: 
Toronto 
 
Vacancies: 
2 
 
Job Term: 
1 Year Contract  Strong Possibility of Extension 
 
Salary: 
$69,425.00 - $100,036.00 Per Year 
 
Job ID: 
181827 
 
 
The Information and Privacy Commissioner of Ontario is an administrative tribunal responsible for the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act (FIPPA), the Municipal Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act (MFIPPA), the Personal Health Information Protection Act (PHIPA) and the Child, Youth and Family Services Act (CYFSA). Under these acts, the Information and Privacy Commissioner, Tribunal Services Division: resolves access to information appeals and complaints when government, health care practitioners/organizations and service providers refuse to grant requests for access or correction; and investigates complaints with respect to the privacy of personal information and personal health information held by government, service providers and health care practitioners/ organizations. 
 
What can I expect to do in this role? 
As an Analyst, you will: 
 
Process access to information appeals, privacy complaints, and privacy breaches reported to the IPC by government institutions, heath information custodians and the child welfare sector, by: 
 
Explaining the operation of these acts to appellants and complaints, and the purpose and process of the Early Resolution stage.Investigating the circumstances and gathering facts surrounding appeals, complaints and self-reported breaches.Attempting to resolve access appeals and privacy complaints using early resolution tactics.Interpreting a broad range of legislation to analyze and determine their applicability to access and privacy rights under the Acts.Conducting research, analyzing past precedents, and where possible, providing parties with advisory opinions on the likely outcome of the access appeal or privacy complaint.Act as a delegated decision maker under the Acts by:Dismissing cases that should not proceed further through the Tribunal processes,Soliciting written representations from the parties, conducting research, analyzing past precedents, and issuing final written decisions with reasons.Act as the Tribunal Services Division's primary contact for the public, by:Responding to correspondence, phone calls and walk-in visits from the public concerning provisions of the Acts; andRedirecting citizens to government that is more appropriate or other organizations 
 
How do I qualify? 
You will qualify for this position by demonstrating: 
 
Knowledge: 
Post-secondary education in a related field, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.Experience processing a caseload in a public sector administrative tribunal and/or health sector regulatory body, and/or similar organization.Understanding of administrative law concepts.Understanding of the provisions and the operation of FIPPA, MFIPPA, PHIPA, and CYFSA. 
 
Interpersonal and Relationship Management Skills: 
The ability to communicate clearly and effectively with a wide range of citizens including those individuals who exhibit adverse and/or demanding behaviour.Ability to establish effective working relationships with employees, management and with both internal and external clients.Ability to work both independently as well as act as an effective team member. 
 
Analytical, Research and Project Management Experience: 
Exceptional organizational and time management skills, able to manage a large caseload.Well-developed analytical/problem solving skills.Ability to plan and conduct extensive research and prepare written reports, evaluations and recommendations. 
 
Communication and Presentation Skills: 
You have well-developed oral communication skills to respond to issues and provide recommendations.You have strong written communication skills to prepare reports and promote initiatives to internal and external stakeholders.You have experience using standard computer software applications (e.g. word processing, spreadsheet) to research and prepare materials. 
 
Preferred Asset Qualifications: 
You have the ability to communicate (orally and in writing) in French. 
 
Applications: 
Send your application to job@ipc.on.caThe deadline to apply isFriday, May 27, 2022 11:59 pm EDT 
 
Notes: 
Commitment to diversity, inclusion, accessibility, and anti-racism: 
We are committed to build a workforce that reflects the communities we serve and to promote a diverse, anti-racist, inclusive, accessible, merit-based, respectful and equitable workplace.We invite all interested individuals to apply and encourage applications from people with disabilities, Indigenous, Black, and racialized individuals, as well as people from a diversity of ethnic and cultural origins, sexual orientations, gender identities and expressions. 
 
Qualified List Information: 
A list of qualified candidates will be established for the Analyst position in the Information and Privacy Commissioner of Ontario and will be in effect for twelve (12) months from the date the list is created. Qualified candidates on the list may be considered when filling future permanent and/or temporary vacancies in this position. 
 
Hybrid Work: 
Like many organizations, the IPC is considering the future of its workplace arrangements. It is developing possibilities for hybrid work and various work arrangements may be possible. 
 
Vaccination Policy: 
Effective December 13, 2021, the IPC's Vaccination Policy requires all IPC employees who enter the office to provide proof they are fully vaccinated, meaning they are fully vaccinated as defined by the Ministry of Health (refer to: COVID-19 Fully Vaccinated Status in Ontario), including 14 calendar days have passed since receiving their final dose of the COVID-19 vaccine.Employees who do not provide proof of full vaccination will be deemed not vaccinated' under the IPC Vaccination Policy and will be required to undergo regular rapid antigen testing to enter the office, including employees with a valid medical exemption.

Description.206:
Contract Role 
 
Tinder is on a mission to change the world by bringing people together and facilitating millions of connections that otherwise might not have been possible. Were looking for a Contract Recruiter to help us attract top talent and grow our awesome product, design, and analytics team. 
 
Reporting to the TA Lead, this will be a highly impactful role responsible for partnering with Engineering teams to understand staffing needs and work collaboratively on recruiting strategies. The ideal candidate for this role has a consultative approach with exceptional analytical and interpersonal skills, and extensive experience in tech recruiting. If youre passionate about developing recruiting strategies that connect meaningfully to our growing business needs, then this is the right role for you. 
 
In this role you will: 
 
Partner closely with the business to identify, build and execute effective recruiting strategies to engage the best and the brightest engineering talentResponsible for full life cycle, recruiting support for engineering teams within TinderBuild and maintain a network of technical talent through ongoing relationship managementEstablish and maintain relationships with hiring managers, and proactively report on pipeline activity to facilitate effective recruiting and hiring discussionsMeasure performance metrics to drive continuous improvement in technical sourcing and recruiting strategies and partner with peers in the execution of these strategiesManage an outstanding and efficient candidate process and experience 
 
We're looking for: 
 
3+ years of experience recruiting for a variety of positions with an emphasis technical or business talentDemonstrated success sourcing and closing technical talent in a high-growth environment within the technology industryStrong knowledge of a web-based ATS, preferably LeverMust be a great networker and have a track record organizing and attending meetups, conferences, and events as a way to attract candidatesExperience with progressive sourcing techniques including direct sourcing and internet data mining and recruiting techniques such as search engines, Boolean search strings, LinkedIn and other online networking communitiesSelf-motivated and driven to succeed while needing minimal supervisionOrganized, able to work in fast-paced environment and handle multiple tasks as well as adapt to business priorities that change quicklyMust have a passion for the the hunt and no fear in picking up the phone to identify and sell passive candidates on opportunitiesCommitment to utilizing your leading edge recruitment techniques, working hard and having fun in a dynamic environment
Description.208:
This is an exciting opportunity to have a key role in overseeing the Information Technology (IT) and Security function at one of Volaris largest portfolios. We have an ambitious vision for acquired and organic growth, globally; combined with ever increasing Data Security and Governance, Risk, and Compliance requirements. Working closely with the Portfolio CFO and the Business Unit leaders, you will have an excellent opportunity to continue to grow and develop an IT strategy, and play an important role as we acquire, strengthen, and grow an expanding Portfolio across the Americas. 
 
If you have a proven track record in a Senior IT and Data Security leadership role, strong work ethic, good interpersonal skills, and the ability to interact with business owners & leaders, we are looking for you. 
 
Responsibilities: 
Overall responsibility for the Portfolios IT, Data Security & Risk Management.Continue to develop and enhance a Portfolio IT & Data Security strategy that allows the portfolio to scale autonomously while ensuring it complies with Volaris & Modaxos corporate standards and governance framework.Review the current state of the Portfolios IT & Data Security compliance with Volaris Governance, Risk Compliance framework, and play an important role in oversight, compliance, control setting, and auditing.Create Portfolio IT & Data Security reporting and dashboards that are reviewed with the executive leadership team regularly.As part of the Mergers & Acquisitions team, identify and propose solutions to IT and Data Security issues found during due diligence and ensure plans are in place post-close to mitigate risks.For all new acquisitions, develop an IT & Data Security integration and compliance checklist, and play an important part of onboarding new acquisitions, including completing the integration of recently acquired businesses.Indirect oversight of all divisional IT teams, supporting the IT leaders and addressing issues and projects arising at their level.Track and manage the Portfolios IT spend, benchmarking, and working to consolidated and reduce operating costs and improve the efficient use of assets across the group.Understand IT infrastructure investments and asset acquisition needs and identify areas of optimization, risk mitigation, and cost-efficiency.Undertake special projects and analysis as required by Portfolio or Business Unit leadership teamsManage the Application Security Product and provide guidance to the Portfolio on the Secure Software Development Process (SSDLC)Lead a Portfolio data security committee, managing the security policies along with security awareness program for businesses in Modaxo Americas. 
 
Education and Experience: 
7 to 8 years of IT experience, including deep exposure to networks and systems at an architect level.One or more security certifications including CISSP is preferredKnowledge of HIPAAHosting environment (Azure, GCP & AWS) architecture and supplier management experience.Proven track record of building strong working relationships with business and IT partners while fostering a cooperative work environment.Ability to think critically, solve problems, and make Portfolio level decisions while building trust within the Volaris head office IT organization.Experience working with Governance, Risk, and Compliance frameworks, including analysis, recommending, implementing, and auditing.Strong project management skills coordinating multiple concurrent complex and high priority projects.Track record of solving large, complex problems and producing measurable results.Self-starter with excellent verbal and written communication skills.Experience building and supporting a global IT team.Experience with global IT and Data Security standards and requirements preferred.Must be willing to travel internationally as required. 
 
If you think this is an exciting role for you. Go ahead and apply at below link: 
 
https://volarisgroup.wd3.myworkdayjobs.com/en-US/Trapeze/details/Director--Information-Technology_R37520

Description.212:
Our company is seeking to hire a project coordinator who will be in charge of assisting our project managers in organizing our ongoing projects. This task involves monitoring project plans, schedules, work hours, budgets, and expenditures, organizing and participating in stakeholder meetings, and ensuring that project deadlines are met in a timely manner. 
To be successful as a project coordinator, you will need to be able to work on tight deadlines, be competent in using Microsoft Office applications such as Word and Excel, and have exceptional verbal, written, and presentation skills. 
Project Management Coordinator Responsibilities: 
Maintaining and monitoring project plans, project schedules, work hours, budgets, and expenditures.Organizing, attending, and participating in stakeholder meetings.Documenting and following up on important actions and decisions from meetings.Preparing necessary presentation materials for meetings.Ensuring project deadlines are met.Determining project changes.Providing administrative support as needed.Undertaking project tasks as required.Developing project strategies.Ensuring projects adhere to frameworks and all documentation is maintained appropriately for each project.Assess project risks and issues and provide solutions where applicable.Ensure stakeholder views are managed towards the best solution.Chair and facilitate meetings where appropriate and distribute minutes to all project team members.Create a project management calendar for fulfilling each goal and objective. 
Project Management Coordinator Requirements: 
Bachelor's degree Exceptional verbal, written, and presentation skills.Ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team.Experience using computers for a variety of tasks.Competency in Microsoft applications including Word, Excel, and Outlook.Knowledge of file management, transcription, and other administrative procedures.Two weeks of paid training required.Ability to work on tight deadlines.

Description.222:
We are hiring for a Meetings and Events Manager. 
Candidate Value Proposition: 
The successful candidate will have the opportunity to gain further knowledge in corporate events planning with a top 5 bank. 
 
Typical Day in Role: 
Provide Support to the Senior Manager and/or the Director while implementing logistic support for various events the team is engaged with, such as quarterly town halls, forums, and meetings on behalf of internal partners.This includes, but is not limited to: negotiating supplier/vendor contracts; collaborating on the event theme design, and coordinating event production schedules and logistical details as appropriate for each event.Work in collaboration with other Event Managers and internal clients to help with the design and management of selected RBC events.Build positive relationships with client groups by demonstrating competence and creativity in supporting their event requirements.Communicate with internal partners and internal & external suppliers in a skilled and professional manner.Support with the management ofall supplier activity during events, including, but not limited to, facility staff, florists, decor vendors, and entertainment.Analyze and produce event-related communications including reports, critical paths, pre-event plans, registration and proposals, and budgets and post-event summaries.Manage the collection of content for the meeting/event including; PPT, video, external speaker presentations, banners, logos, Mobile appContribute to the maintenance of the Meetings & Events Team RBCnet website and RBC Connect websites and research, write and grow the content, including templates and tutorials.Keep current on industry news and trends.

Degree/diploma or equivalent in event management or hospitalityMinimum 4 years of work experience in meeting/event planning.Ability to work very effectively and collaboratively in a team environmentStrong planning, organization, and problem-solving skills in order to manage multiple projects, with the ability to identify challenges and propose solutionsCommunication and verbal and written communications skills; strong customer service orientation; ability to interact effectively with senior-level management.Flexible attitude, teamwork and cooperation skills; collaboration, relationship building skills, sound judgment, diplomacy, and discretion.Ability and willingness to travel within the GTA area for various event locations/sites.Event Management/Registration tools experience: TemboSocial, Cvent, Survey Monkey, Limelight, QuickMobile App

Description.225:
We're looking for an organized and driven Accounting intern to join our finance team at BrightOrder Inc. The Accounting intern position will work closely with General Accountant, Finance Manager and Operations personnel.The intern will be part of a dynamic Finance team with experience in Accounts Receivable - Billing/Collections, Accounts Payable, and Payroll. This range of experience will give you the confidence to take on additional roles as required and support the team's objectives. 
The successful candidate will be talented and self-motivated, a quick learner and versatile that is comfortable working in a fast-paced and evolving environment. This position requires someone who can work within a team, both within the finance group and with employees at all levels of the organization. 
 
Please note, this internship is part time 24 hours per week. 
 
Main Responsibilities: 
 
Support General Accountant for full accounting cycle and preparation of financial statements;Prepare general ledger entries by maintaining records and files, reconciling accounts, preparing and maintaining monthly prepaid schedulesMaintain customers billing on a daily basis;Update the customers subscription billing software platform along with the customers credit card payment platform. Deal with new customers quires when needed;Investigate billing and payment discrepancy. Resolving issues associated with unmatched receipts and resolving customer queries;Maintain a high level of professional service and customer satisfaction in all interactions with external and internal customers to promote prompt payment of receivables;Monitor A/R aging and collection of past due balances, if any. Ad-hoc AR Aging reports as requested by management;Suppliers bills review against purchase agreements and purchase orders. Bills entry and payment preparation;Suppliers account reconciliation and communication with local and international vendorsUpload and track expense reports from the expense management software into the accounting system;Process bank deposits and monthly payments. Reconcile general and subsidiary bank accounts by gathering and balancing information. Complete monthly credit card reconciliations;Complete monthly payroll reconciliation and records for all subsidiaries;Provide assistance in month-end and year-end closing - account reconciliations, accruals, journal entries and analysis; Provides financial status information by preparing special reports; completing special projects;Any additional duties and responsibilities as may be assigned from time to time.Ensure and enforce compliance to all company and legislated Safety policies and procedures;Updates job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications. 
 
Key Competencies & Requirements: 
 
Highly organized, exceptional attention to detail, accuracy and able to multi-task and prioritize in a fast-paced environment;Excellent problem-solving skills as well as strong written and verbal communication skills;Excellent analytical, financial, and mathematical abilitiesAbility to gather data, establish facts, draw valid conclusions, and propose solutions;Proficient with financial systems, processes and technology;Knowledge of General Accounting Principles and ProceduresIntermediate level MS Excel skills including VLOOKUP's and pivot tables is required Have an intellectual curiosity for discovery and questioning the status quoKnow what they do not know, and ask before actionStress tolerance due to fluctuations in workload. 
 
Education and Experience: 
Enrollment in a Bachelor's Degree/ Program in Accounting and/or FinanceKnowledge of advanced accountingAdvanced computer skills in MS Office, accounting software, and databasesExperience with SaaS companies - an asset 
 
If you are interested in this position, then please submit your resume AND send a short 2 minute introductory video telling us why you would be an excellent fit for the position to the email: recruiting@brightorder.com.

Description.231:
Event Operations Coordinator at TechTO 
 
TechTO is seeking a full-time Event Operations Coordinator to help action logistical tasks that support company-wide event management. This individual will focus on supporting the team; ensuring we execute events and projects efficiently, and that we have clear processes in place to track and evolve our goals as we help grow the Canadian tech industry ecosystem. 
 
What you will do: 
 
Support the logistical execution of our in-person and virtual events. We are very excited about the increase of IRL event opportunities across Canada, and want to continue growing our community via virtual events as well. You will help build strong relationships with our event partners, and grow our list of logistical suppliers. You will support the co-founders and core team with coordinating activities, and will report to the Events Lead. This is a great opportunity for a forward-thinking, follow-up-driven individual who wants to eventually move forward in event management. 
 
Provide day-to-day customer support and enhance the event experience. Our events (both virtual and in-person) are legitimately fun and we love hosting them. We are looking for someone who would be excited to both plan and attend each event, and interact with our volunteers and communities so that we can continue curating events that encourage growth and connection. 
 
Report and track our progress and lessons. You will ensure that the core team can easily access data that highlights key performance details and strategic insights from our events. Analytical and critical thinking skills are a must. 
 
Support event financial tracking and monitor our technical systems. Its ok if youre not a finance guru, but we definitely need someone who likes mental math and making sure the numbers make sense! You will also need to be comfortable learning the ins-and-outs of our technical ticketing, project management, and communications systems to help maximize efficiency. 
 
Perform ad-hoc industry research in support of our events strategy. Either on your own, or as requested by the core team and co-founders. Were a small team with a lot going on, were looking for a self-starter with a drive to learn and educate so that we can set and exceed targets after each successful event. 
 
What success looks like: 
You allow us to increase the number of events in our calendar, both virtual and in-person.You become a TechTO events champion and communicate opportunities to improve our communitys event experience to the core team.You take pride in your work. We do some really cool stuff, and youll be an integral part of the core team as we grow.Youve got this. You can execute your tasks confidently and enjoy creative problem solving. Were still mostly working from home, so its important for us all to trust that tasks are being completed independently. Were all happy to jump in and support navigating challenges, dont expect constant hand-holding or micromanaging.You love to learn and build connections. Our community is all about enriching Canadas tech ecosystem with shared lessons and experiences.Change thrills you. We adapt to changing circumstances from a wide variety of key stakeholders all of the time. 
 
You are: 
A recent graduate or entry-level opportunity seeker (ideally) with some experience in customer service and/or event management. Preference will be given to folks who are available long-term.Interested in executing successful in-person and virtual events from ideation to completion.Comfortable with independent work but dont hesitate to raise your hand and ask questions when necessary.Excited by self-guided learning.Diligent with keeping track of documentation using Google Workspace and Slack.Able to organize and prioritize multiple tasks at once.Excited by the opportunity to build a role in a growing company. This is a new position and were excited about creating a set of responsibilities that matches the skills and passions of the candidate.Enjoy using data to measure success.Looking to join an exciting core team. We want everyone to learn new skills, experience personal growth, and develop new responsibilities as we all ride the roller coaster together. 
 
Whats in it for you: 
 
We may be biased but were a pretty rad team. We may not have beer on Fridays or a foosball table, but we value everyones voice, we care about our teams personal and professional growth, and we want you to find your space to thrive at TechTO. We move fast and we adapt quickly. If youre someone who is excited about taking ownership and driving our event experiences, then we want you to come along for the ride. 
 
How to apply: 
 
Apply via this postAttach your resumeA short note about why you think you'd be good for the job (we dont need a full cover letter) 
 
About TechTO 
 
TechTO aspires to build a community that makes Canada the best place in the world to start or scale a technology company. To make that vision a reality, we focus on three broad goals: improving access to the innovation economy, sharing strategies to accelerate professional success, and promoting the tech communitys contributions to society. Plus, we like to make people laugh. 
 
We support entrepreneurs and innovators at all stages of their careers and businesses. We host events, both in-person and online. We help people develop new skills. We connect people and expand networks. We build relationships and form partnerships. We speak with the media. We advocate for the tech sector. We meet with governments and policymakers. In short, we do whatever it takes to support Canadas tech community. Check out techto.org to learn more about what we do. 
 
TechTO is an equal opportunity employer and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any kind. TechTO is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for everyone and providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment.
Description.232:
Permanent, Full-Time 
$86,395.13 to $107,993.91 annually 
 
Reporting to the Manager, Project Management Office and Business Transformation, the Consultant, PMO is responsible for planning, coordinating and reporting on various continuous improvement projects for the Office of Project Management and Business Transformation by applying project management methodologies and supporting the analysis, evaluation and implementation of project plans and activities.

Our company is seeking to hire a project coordinator who will be in charge of assisting our project managers in organizing our ongoing projects. This task involves monitoring project plans, schedules, work hours, budgets, and expenditures, organizing and participating in stakeholder meetings, and ensuring that project deadlines are met in a timely manner. 
To be successful as a project coordinator, you will need to be able to work on tight deadlines, be competent in using Microsoft Office applications such as Word and Excel, and have exceptional verbal, written, and presentation skills.

Maintaining and monitoring project plans, project schedules, work hours, budgets, and expenditures.Organizing, attending, and participating in stakeholder meetings.Documenting and following up on important actions and decisions from meetings.Preparing necessary presentation materials for meetings.Ensuring project deadlines are met.Determining project changes.Providing administrative support as needed.Undertaking project tasks as required.Developing project strategies.Ensuring projects adhere to frameworks and all documentation is maintained appropriately for each project.Assess project risks and issues and provide solutions where applicable.Ensure stakeholder views are managed towards the best solution.Chair and facilitate meetings where appropriate and distribute minutes to all project team members.Create a project management calendar for fulfilling each goal and objective.

Description.235:
We are looking for a responsible Administrative Assistant to perform a variety of administrative and clerical tasks. 
 
The duties of the Administrative Assistant include providing support to our managers and employees, assisting in daily office needs, and managing our companys general administrative activities. 
 
What does an Administrative Assistant do? 
Administrative Assistant responsibilities include making travel and meeting arrangements, preparing reports, and maintaining appropriate filing systems. The ideal candidate should have excellent oral and written communication skills and be able to organize their work using tools, like MS Excel and office equipment. If you also have previous experience as a Secretary or Executive Administrative Assistant and familiarity with our industry, wed like to meet you. 
 
Ultimately, a successful Admin Assistant should ensure the efficient and smooth day-to-day operation of our office. 
 
Responsibilities; 
Answer and direct phone calls 
Organize and schedule appointments 
Plan meetings and take detailed minutes 
Write and distribute email, correspondence memos, letters, faxes, and forms 
Assist in the preparation of regularly scheduled reports 
Develop and maintain a filing system 
Update and maintain office policies and procedures 
Order office supplies and research new deals and suppliers 
Maintain contact lists 
Book travel arrangements 
Submit and reconcile expense reports 
Provide general support to visitors 
Act as the point of contact for internal and external clients 
Liaise with executive and senior administrative assistants to handle requests and queries from senior managers 
 
Requirements; 
Proven experience as an Administrative Assistant, Virtual Assistant, or Office Admin Assistant 
Knowledge of office management systems and procedures 
Working knowledge of office equipment, like printers and fax machines 
Proficiency in MS Office (MS Excel and MS PowerPoint, in particular) 
Excellent time management skills and the ability to prioritize work 
Attention to detail and problem-solving skills 
Excellent written and verbal communication skills 
Strong organizational skills with the ability to multi-task 
High School degree; additional qualification as an Administrative assistant or Secretary will be a plus. 
 
Important Note: 
 
The Job briefing and interview session will be conducted online via the Skype app. 
Are you familiar with Skype? If not, You are required to download the app on the Google Play Store or App Store. 
 
Once you are done with the download, you are to set up an account with your Current Email address and add up the recruitment adviser with the email below 
(talent@hrmprojectdept.com), send a message to her in regards to an online interview. 
Notify once done by sending a message stating I AM READY.

Description.239:
We believe that everyone has the right to DEFINE themselves and their future. 
 
That includes YOU. 
 
How would you like to do it in a fun, high-performance culture thats truly one of a kind  on a team that appreciates you for being you, helps our members retire with confidence and makes Canada better, all at the same time? 
 
If that sounds like your thing  and youre an exceptional Administrative Assistant  wed like to hear from you. 
 
Were CAAT Pension Plan, and were growing. We innovate defined benefit (DB) pension plans. What are they? Unlike other pension plans, they specifically define the lifetime benefits our members will receive in retirement. This means that our members know exactly what theyre getting every month  for life! Because we provide that certainty, we help more Canadians retire with greater financial security and priceless peace of mind and take pressure off the social safety net at the very same time, which frees up those resources for other Canadians who really need them. 
 
We are looking for a conscientious critical thinker to join our Pension Solutions team as an Administrative Assistant where the work will be dynamic and sometimes unpredictable. This role is important because you will be the day-to-day conduit between teams, providing administrative and support services to the Pension Solutions Team. 
 
 
We are look for someone with the following attribute: 
 
Excellent communication skills (both written and oral)Exceptional judgement, strong team player, thorough, and logicalExceptional interpersonal skills, with a positive can-do approachExperience with project coordination Someone who thrives juggling multiple priorities 
 
A University or College Degree in Business, Office Administration or equivalent, with two years or more of progressive office support experience make you an ideal candidate. You must also have an aptitude for project coordination, a high proficiency in Microsoft Office (including proficiency in Excel), and Customer Relations Management (CRM) software experience. 
 
Once here: 
 
You will provide a full range of administrative and support servicesYou will coordinate a variety of project initiatives and tasksYou will assist in preparation for and facilitation of internal and external meetingsYou will provide support in the preparation of internal reportsYou will assist with other tasks as assigned 
 
 
What does CAAT offer you and what should you know about us? 
 
Our vision is to provide an environment where employees can bring their whole, authentic selves to work. Thats what drives our high-performance, fun culture  one thats truly one of a kind. In fact, we have been recognized as one of Canada's Most Admired Corporate Cultures for 2019 and 2020, as one of Greater Toronto's Top Employers for 2020 and 2021, and by Canadian HR Reporter as one of the Best Places to Work for 2021.We provide (no big surprise here!) membership in CAATs defined benefit (DB) pension plan, a flexible and friendly work environment, a comprehensive health and dental benefits package, life insurance, and an array of wellness programsEveryone is a leader at CAAT, so we invest in our people and enthusiastically support your career development goals, regardless of your role, with access to tuition aid and learning opportunities like our ground-breaking CAAT AcademyWe are conveniently located at the Eaton Centre in downtown Toronto, next to Queen Subway station, with ready access to multiple TTC routes, GO Transit, and the PATH.We are working remotely at present due to the COVID-19 pandemic, and in the future will be offering a flexible, hybrid work arrangement.You can learn more at www.caatpension.ca 
 
DEFINITELY INTERESTED? Apply on LinkedIn and include your resume and cover letter or email your resume and cover letter to careers@caatpension.ca on or before May 20, 2022, with  Administrative Assistant in the subject line. 
 
We recruit and select the most qualified candidates and thank all applicants for their interest. Only those considered for an interview will be contacted. 
 
CAAT Pension Plan is an equal opportunity employer that supports abilities and diversity of all kinds. If you require accommodation during the recruiting and selection process, please contact us at hr@caatpension.ca or call Human Resources at 416-673-9000.

To be successful as a project coordinator, you will need to be able to work on tight deadlines, be competent in using Microsoft Office applications such as Word and Excel, and have exceptional verbal, written, and presentation skills.

Description.263:
Organization: 
The Information and Privacy Commissioner of Ontario 
 
Division / Department: 
Tribunal and Dispute Resolution Division / Intake & Early Resolution Department 
 
City: 
Toronto 
 
Vacancies: 
2 
 
Job Term: 
1 Year Contract  Strong Possibility of Extension 
 
Salary: 
$69,425.00 - $100,036.00 Per Year 
 
Job ID: 
181827 
 
 
The Information and Privacy Commissioner of Ontario is an administrative tribunal responsible for the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act (FIPPA), the Municipal Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act (MFIPPA), the Personal Health Information Protection Act (PHIPA) and the Child, Youth and Family Services Act (CYFSA). Under these acts, the Information and Privacy Commissioner, Tribunal Services Division: resolves access to information appeals and complaints when government, health care practitioners/organizations and service providers refuse to grant requests for access or correction; and investigates complaints with respect to the privacy of personal information and personal health information held by government, service providers and health care practitioners/ organizations. 
 
What can I expect to do in this role? 
As an Analyst, you will: 
 
Process access to information appeals, privacy complaints, and privacy breaches reported to the IPC by government institutions, heath information custodians and the child welfare sector, by: 
 
Explaining the operation of these acts to appellants and complaints, and the purpose and process of the Early Resolution stage.Investigating the circumstances and gathering facts surrounding appeals, complaints and self-reported breaches.Attempting to resolve access appeals and privacy complaints using early resolution tactics.Interpreting a broad range of legislation to analyze and determine their applicability to access and privacy rights under the Acts.Conducting research, analyzing past precedents, and where possible, providing parties with advisory opinions on the likely outcome of the access appeal or privacy complaint.Act as a delegated decision maker under the Acts by:Dismissing cases that should not proceed further through the Tribunal processes,Soliciting written representations from the parties, conducting research, analyzing past precedents, and issuing final written decisions with reasons.Act as the Tribunal Services Division's primary contact for the public, by:Responding to correspondence, phone calls and walk-in visits from the public concerning provisions of the Acts; andRedirecting citizens to government that is more appropriate or other organizations 
 
How do I qualify? 
You will qualify for this position by demonstrating: 
 
Knowledge:
